strings.string: No Accounts have been created. Please Create a new account.
Server address wrong or wrong SSL
Testing all necessary settings have been entered
POP3 Server did not accept User Name or User Password
SMTP Server did not accept User Name or User Password
Any un-saved account settings will be lost.
You can not have two Inboxes in the same account with the same Display Name.
You can not have two Accounts with the same Account Name.
Keep copies of Emails on server:
Select if you wish to LOGIN to a XinBox Account. If no accounts have been created, then you must CREATE an XinBox Account before logging in.
Select if you wish to CREATE a new XinBox Account. A XinBox account is required to LOGIN.
Select if you wish to UPDATE the XinBox script.
Select if you wish to find out ABOUT the XinBox script.
Select if you wish to EXIT the XinBox script and return to XBMC.
Select to set the Account Name for your XinBox Account. Note: You will be unable to save your account without an Account Name.
Select to set the Account Password for your XinBox Account. Leave empty to disable a password for this account.
Select to toggle if this Account is the Default Account. A Default Account automatically logs in on script start-up. Note: There can only be a maximum of one Default Account.
Select to Add a new Inbox to this Account.
Select to Edit an Inbox in this Account.
Select to Delete an Inbox in this Account.
Select to Save all changed settings in this Account.
Select to exit this menu. Note: Any unsaved data will be lost.

Select to change your Display Name. This is the name of the Inbox and also the name that will appear in the From field of any outgoing E-mails. Note: You will not be able to add an inbox to your account without a Display Name.
Select to change your E-mail Address. This is the E-mail address other people use to send E-mail messages to you.
A: Change your Incoming mail (POP3) Server. Eg. pop.gmail.com White Button: Change your POP3 SSL Server Port Number. Only some servers require this. Eg. Gmail - Pop3 SSL Port# 995
A: Change your Outgoing mail (SMTP) Server. Eg. smtp.gmail.com White Button: Change your SMTP SSL Server Port Number. Only some servers require this. Eg. Gmail - SMTP SSL Port# 587
Select to change your Server Account Name. This is usually the name you use to login to Outlook/Web Mail Inboxes.
Select to change your Server Account Password. This is usually the password you use to login to Outlook/Web Mail Inboxes.
Select to change your Server Inbox Size. Enter the size(capacity) of your e-mail servers inbox in megabytes(MB).Set to 0 to disable the server inbox full warnings.
Select to change your XinBox Inbox Size. Enter the size(capacity) you want to allocate on your Xbox to this Inbox in Megabytes(MB).Set to 0 to disable the XinBox inbox full Warnings.
Select to change if copies of any new emails from when setting is changed are kept on the server. Defaults to Yes.
Select to Test the above inbox settings. "Test" will communicate with the inbox server and confirm all settings are ok.
Select to add inbox to your Account and return to the Account Menu. Note: The inbox will not be saved until Save is pressed in the Account Menu.
Select to Login to this account.
Select to Login to this inbox.
Select to exit the XinBox Script.
Select to change the "New Email" notification SFX. This is played when new emails are received into this Inbox. Select silent.wav to disable the SFX.
Select to confirm changes to your inbox and return to the Account Menu. Note: The inbox changes will not be saved until the Account is saved.
Select to toggle if this Inbox is the Default Inbox. A Default Inbox automatically logs in when the account is logged in to. Note: There can only be a maximum of one Default Inbox per Account.
Select to check for new emails.
Select to compose a new email.
Select to reset this inbox. Note: Resetting an inbox will delete all emails in the inbox not the server.
Select to activate Mini-Mode. This will close the script and continue to check for emails whilst you eg. watch a move. It will notify you of new emails when received.
A: Open this email B: Quick Delete this email from Inbox Only White Button: Add sender of this email to Contacts
A: Show/Hide Compatible Attachments (Images, Zips',Text File, Video/Audio) White Button: Save attachment
Select to Reply to this email. Replying will close this window and open the new Reply Window.
Select to Forward this email. Forwarding will close this window and open the new Forward Window.
Select to Delete this email from either Inbox/Server/Both. If Server/Both are not shown, this is due to the email not being present on the server.
Select to open/close the attachment panel.
Select to PageUp/PageDown through the email body/attached text files.
A: Save the current highlighted file in the .zip archive
Select to toggle if XinBox Mini-Mode runs on start-up of XBMC.
Select to change the delay (in seconds) between checking for new emails while Mini-Mode is running.
Select to toggle if this Inbox is to be checked when Mini-Mode is running.
A: Edit the To: field. Multiple To: addresses can be split using ; only B: Clear the To: field White Button: Open Contacts Panel
A: Edit the Cc: field. Multiple Cc: addresses can be split using ; only B: Clear the Cc: field White Button: Open Contacts Panel
A: Edit the Bcc: field. Multiple Bcc: addresses can be split using ; only B: Clear the Bcc: field White Button: Open Contacts Panel
A: Edit the Subject field B: Clear the Subject Field
A: Edit highlighted line B: Delete current highlighted line White Button: Add new line below current highlighted line
Select to Clear the email body.
Select to Add a new attachment to this email.
B: Remove this attachment from email.
Select to open the Contacts menu.
A: Edit Contact Name/Email address B: Delete contact White Button: Compose Email to Contact
Select to add a new Contact.
A: Edit Contact Name/Email address B: Delete contact White Button: Add Contact to Address Field
Select to toggle if Mini-Mode will play your selected inbox "New Email" notification SFX.
Select to toggle if two XinBox + XBMC promoting lines are added to bottom of emails sent with XinBox.
Select to either Update to this Version or read this Version's Change Log.
Select to Fetch and read the Change Log for this Version.
Select to Update XinBox to this Version.
Select to Compose a New Email to All Contacts.
Select to add All Contacts to Address Field.
Select to Mark this email as Un-Read.
Select to toggle if this accounts inboxes automatically check for new emails on login.
Select to browse for and import a .csv Address Book export file. See readme.txt for more details.
Select to toggle if Email Status Notification "Ok" dialogs are shown in this accounts inboxes.
All inboxes in this account will also be deleted.
Email was not found on server
Deleting email from server and inbox
All emails in inbox will be deleted.
Failed to login into SMTP Server.
Contact Already Exists in Address Field
Your version is up to date.
There was an error updating script!
No Change Log Available for this Version.
